https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city.summary: A fire broke out at Ganpat Patil Nagar in Borivli, Mumbai, on November 22, 2025, at 5:29 pm. The blaze, covering 500 x 150 sq ft across 8-10 galas, was confined to electric wiring, wooden furniture, and other materials. The fire was brought under control and extinguished by 8:40 pm, with no reported injuries.

https://mu.ac.in/old/examination.html.summary:
Here's a summary of the content:

* Examination forms for Winter 2025 (SH 2025) and Summer 2025 (FH 2025) exams are available.
* Circulars have been issued for the implementation of NEP-2020 Examination and Evaluation Guidelines for UG Programs (Arts, Science, Commerce & Management) Semesters I to II.
* The Centre for Distance & Online Education (CDOE) examinations have been rescheduled.
* UG NEP (Semester I-KT) and UG NEP (Semester II-Regular) examinations will be held as per revised dates.
* The statement of the balance stock of blank OSM cum bar-coded answer books of 32 page & 8 page (Pink Colour) and stationary is available.
* The dates for issue and return of examination forms for various courses are mentioned.
* The dates for the distribution and collection of examination materials, such as question papers and answer sheets, are also mentioned.
* The last dates for submission of examination forms for various courses are December 4, 2024, for the winter session and February 2025 for the summer session.
* The University of Mumbai has issued various circulars and notifications regarding the examination process, evaluation guidelines, and other important dates.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/indi.summary:
Karnataka CM tussle: Congress high command intervenes. Key points:

- November 28, 2025: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah invites Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar for breakfast at the direction of the party high command.
- The meeting is aimed at discussing the "power tussle" over the chief ministerial post, which has been ongoing since the Congress government reached its halfway mark.
- The party high command has asked Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar to meet, with both leaders stating they will obey the command.
- This comes amid a tug-of-war between Siddaramaiah and DKS over the CM post, with DKS's faction reportedly pushing for a leadership transition.
- The Congress government completed 2.5 years in power, prompting speculation about a leadership change.
- DKS claimed there was a "confidential understanding on leadership transition" among top leaders after the 2023 elections.

https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-new.summary:
Cyclone Ditwah is moving north-northwest over Sri Lanka and the Bay of Bengal. Key updates include:

- The storm is expected to approach Tamil Nadu and south Andhra Pradesh by November 30.
- As of November 28, 5:30 am IST, the storm was positioned at 8.2 degrees North, 81.1 degrees East, roughly 50 km south-southwest of Trincomalee.
- The storm is advancing at a speed of 7 kmph.
- The system is expected to trigger heavy to very heavy rain across southern India from November 28 to December 2.
- Five states are on alert, with Tamil Nadu, south Andhra Pradesh, Puducherry, and four districts of Tamil Nadu under a red alert.

https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/k.summary:
Key entities: 
- Siddaramaiah (Karnataka Chief Minister)
- D.K. Shivakumar (Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister)
- The Congress (Indian National Congress)
- BJP (Bharatiya Janata Party)
- JD(S) (Janaadhipathya Janata Paksha)
- Karnataka
- Belagavi

Important dates:
- November 28, 2025
- November 29, 2025 (breakfast meeting between Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar)
- December 1, 2025 (Winter Session of Parliament begins)
- December 8, 2025 (Winter Session of State legislature session in Belagavi)

Summary:
Siddaramaiah and D.K. Shivakumar, leaders involved in a leadership battle within the Congress party, have agreed to a breakfast meeting on November 29. This comes after the high command instructed them to hold a meeting to control damage to the party and government ahead of the State legislature session. The meeting aims to send a message to rival parties (BJP and JD(S)) that the ruling dispensation is stable.

https://indianexpress.com/article/explai.summary:
Here's a summary of the web content in under 300 words:

The Sanchar Saathi app is a cybersecurity application developed by the Indian government to help users report fraudulent calls, messages, and stolen mobile phones. The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) directed Indian smartphone companies to pre-install the app on all new devices sold in India. Initially, the DoT said users couldn't delete the app, but Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia later clarified that it's optional and users can delete the app if they want to.

The DoT's directive sparked criticism over privacy and surveillance issues, with some calling it a state-mandated software that users can't control or remove. Digital rights group Internet Freedom Foundation expressed concerns that the app will require system-level access, eroding protections that prevent one app from accessing data from others.

Key facts:

- The Sanchar Saathi app is a government-developed cybersecurity application.
- The DoT directed Indian smartphone companies to pre-install the app on all new devices sold in India.
- The initial directive said users couldn't delete the app, but it's now optional.
- Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia clarified that users can delete the app if they want to.
- The DoT directed a software update with the app to be issued to already-sold phones.
- The directive was issued on November 28, 2025, under the Telecommunication Cybersecurity Amendment Rules, 2025.

Key entities:

- Sanchar Saathi app
- Department of Telecommunications (DoT)
- Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia
- Internet Freedom Foundation
- Indian government
- Indian smartphone companies
